{{ _('

The High School Affiliated to Renmin University of China, abbreviated to Renda Fuzhong (RDFZ) was founded in 1940 and has become one of Chinaâ€™s top high schools. The main school has over 4500 students and is heavily oversubscribed, graduating students enter the best Chinese universities and the students from the school usually attain the top national university entrance exam marks on course completion. The school is in the Haidian university district of Beijing in a closed and very beautiful campus. Beijing Capital Airport is less than an hour away.

') }} {{ _('

The High School Affiliated to Renmin University of China is a world-renowned public school founded in 1950.

The school offers both Chinese and international curricula.

Two types of Chinese curricula are offered: the national curriculum and the Early Development Program for Top Innovative Talents.

Three international curricula are offered at the Chinese-Foreign Education Program: the Cambridge International Advanced Level (A Level) program, started in 2004; the Advanced Placement (AP) program, started in 2010; and the International Baccalaureate Diploma (IB) program, started in 2012.

Students are regularly admitted to top Universities domestically and abroad.

') }}

{{ _('Accreditation') }}

{{ _('

RDFZ has been fully accredited by the University of Cambridge International Examinations (CIE) since 2004.

The Cambridge Exam Center number is CN230.

In 2012 RDFZ received lBO authorization to offer the IBDP, and the IB School Code is 049099.

RDFZ's CEEB code: 694270

') }}
